instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3209: What is 820-3209? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.
definitions.SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SDA: What is SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SDA? SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SDA is the data line of an I2C data line between the battery charging chip that creates PPBUS_G3H, the system management controller(SMC), the battery, and the battery indicator LED. If this line’s resistance to ground is too low because of a defective component, battery will not be recognized with an X on the icon and PPBUS_G3H voltage will be lower than it is on a good system..
definitions.SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SCL: What is SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SCL? SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SCL is the clock line of an I2C data line between the battery charging chip that creates PPBUS_G3H, the system management controller(SMC), the battery, and the battery indicator LED. If this line’s resistance to ground is too low because of a defective component, battery will not be recognized with an X on the icon and PPBUS_G3H voltage will be lower than it is on a good system..
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Pro Retina No Battery, No X, Nothing.
threads.message:
Hi.

[B]History:[/B]
Pro Retina board had short to ground on <SIGNAL>SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SCL</SIGNAL>.
Cut trace by SMC and found dead short on SMC side.
Removed SMC dead short gone.
Replaced SMC, fixed cut trace, machine boots fine and no dead short.

[B]Now:[/B]
<SIGNAL>SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SCL</SIGNAL> no longer dead short but only pulls up to 1V13 (not batt connected)
<SIGNAL>SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SDA</SIGNAL> pulls up to 3V5, pulses. (no bat connected)
Not powering from battery, no X, ASD does not test battery.
Green / Orange on MagSafe is there

[B]Checked:[/B]
Removed the wire on <SIGNAL>SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SCL</SIGNAL> to SMC to double check. Voltage still 1V13. Will stick the wire back on the trace.
<RESISTOR>R5381</RESISTOR> & <RESISTOR>R5380</RESISTOR> measure fine = 1.973K & 1.933K

So if it's not the SMC and it's not the battery and it's not the pullups then it must be <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP> right?.... Or am I missing something?
Anything I should be looking for here that I'm not looking for now?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Pro Retina No Battery, No X, Nothing.
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Pro Retina No Battery, No X, Nothing.
threads.message: Very common for SMC and IS6259 to both fail. If this happened by liquid a dead battery is also very likely.
